availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Adolphus Lafayette Reid (Greenup County, Kentucky, farmer, and sheriff. )

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, farmer, and sheriff. Natchez, Mississippi, native. Son of Darious B. Reid and Caroline Roach. Married to Henrietta Powell Reid on April 20, 1848. Father of Charles E. Reid, Lucky C. Reid, Anna M. Reid, Rob Morris Reid, and Edgar Reid. Farmer in Greenup County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Greenup County in 1860. Sheriff in Greenup County from 1862 to 1863. Farmer in Greenup County in 1863.

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994036, Greenup County Births.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #14051.

Nina Mitchell Biggs and Mabel Lee Mackoy, History of Greenup County, Kentucky, (Evansville, Indiana: Unigraphic, 1975) 122, 247.
